The plastic industry would need to adapt to producing biodegradable plastic, leading to a shift towards more sustainable practices.
The rate of plastic pollution would decrease dramatically, resulting in cleaner oceans, forests, and landscapes.
The demand for plastic products would decrease, potentially leading to a decrease in production and the associated environmental impact.
The focus on plastic waste management would shift towards finding alternative uses for plastic waste, such as in the production of biofuels or other renewable resources.
The development of new biodegradable plastics would lead to the creation of new industries and job opportunities in the field of sustainable materials.
